name: BOYSEN®® Lacquer Primer Surfacer B‑305

info.title: DESCRIPTION
info.body: BOYSEN®® Lacquer Primer Surfacer B‑305 is a nitrocellulose lacquer type sealer with excellent holdout properties that provides a good foundation for the desired lacquer topcoat.

info.title: PRINCIPAL USES
info.body: It is ideal as primer for interior wooden surfaces.

info.title: SURFACE PREPARATION
info.subtitle: Wooden Surfaces
info.body: Surface to be painted should be clean and dry, free from dust, dirt, and other foreign matter. Hammer all nails deep enough to apply putty. Sand rough wood until smooth and then dust off before painting.

info.title: SURFACE PREPARATION
info.subtitle: Repainting
info.body: Scrape off all loose, scaling, flaking, and peeling paint manually or by using BOYSEN®® Paint and Varnish Remover B‑141, as necessary. Wash surfaces clean and completely remove chemical residue. Let it dry. If old lacquer finish is in good condition, sand surface lightly to provide anchorage for succeeding coats.

info.title: PAINTING SCHEDULE
info.subtitle: New Wooden Surfaces
info.body: 1st coat: BOYSEN®® Lacquer Primer Surfacer B‑305 2nd coat: BOYSEN®® Lacquer Spot Putty B‑306 3rd coat: BOYSEN®® Lacquer Primer Surfacer B‑305 Final coat: BOYSEN®® Automotive Lacquer B‑1300 or BOYSEN®® Gloss Lacquer Enamel B‑1200
